website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for larger users at a reasonable price point with attractive extras, though some find its lightweight build too flimsy, particularly at the arms.
pros: Heavy-duty chair works well for larger users
The built-in cooler gets big thumbs up from owners, as does its storage pocket and ample cup holder
Lasts through multiple outdoor seasons for most
cons: A few reports of chair fabric ripping away after just a few uses
Caution must be used when pressing the chair arms to get in or out of this quad chair, users find
Some have difficulty repacking in storage bag
Shorter users find this chair uncomfortable

customer_reviews.title: FMF Chair = Fat Man Friendly Chair
customer_reviews.text: Best camping chair I've owned. I won't get specific with my dimensions but I'm a pretty big guy. Most chairs you find in stores are designed for skinny people whereas this chair works well with my large body.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: we loved it!
customer_reviews.text: It is a comfortable portable chair and also the picture on amazon does not look good but the chair looks pretty good! we loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair for camping this past week on Slickdeals. I decided to test it at the Seaside Beach Volleyball Tournament last Sunday for the first time. The chair broke with less than 2-3 hours of use. I am 5'9" 165 pounds so I don't think weight was an issue either. Maybe I got a faulty chair I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CHAIR
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my husband. We went fishing at the beach. Within 1 hour of him sitting in the chair, on and off, it broke on one side. After another hour, it broke on the other side. He was not sitting in the chair for 2 straight hours. When you are fishing, you are on and off the chair. I have purchased less expensive chairs with no brand name and they have lasted for years. We had to leave early because my husband didn't have a chair to sit on. I AM TRULY DISAPPOINTED WITH THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda O.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: The tubing for the chair frame is much too light gauge... too thin.The tubing snapped where a rivet joined two tubes with the seat bottom.The chair had only seen light use.
customer_reviews.author: BruceJT

customer_reviews.title: Bad design
customer_reviews.text: This chair broke the first time we used it. One of the arms snapped right off. Cannot reach company to replace. Would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Keysqueen

customer_reviews.title: Holds Me Up Just Fine!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is GREAT! I'm anywhere from 245lbs - 275lbs depending on the day of the week, and this chair never gets scared when I go to sit down! The build-in cooler is a nice addition, though I usually end up using it as a waterproof trash can for empty cans instead of putting in full cans - since it would only hold 3 or so when full. When crushed it will hold as many as you can stuff into it. I've purchased 2 of these and sometimes you can find them on Amazon for under $20, so wait for the good deal before purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: The Chad

customer_reviews.title: Great chair but one broke after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Really liked these chairs, bought 2 then ordered 2 more. Unfortunately one of the legs had a bolt come out and is lost. The leg will sit in the foot but has to be placed each time. Have only used it 3 times. Not from weight, bolt came loose. The chairs are spacious and comfortable. The cooler pouch in the left arm is cool. Will hold a couple of bottles of water and ice to cool them for these hot baseball games. Chairs fold easily and can get back into the bag easily. I would have given them a 5-Star rating but the fact that one broke so soon is really unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Metal Arm Frame Is THE Weak Link - Bends & Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: You would think these would be good chairs and last a long time with occasional use. Not so. The "achilles heel" of this chair is the metal arm design. When you stand up (you're sitting low because of the design), you grab the arms for support. The curved arm, from the armrest cover to just below where the seat is attached, is the weak link in this chair. It will bend and there is no way to straighten it back without the metal arm breaking. There MUST be better designed chairs out there.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Quality chair for larger people
customer_reviews.text: chair seems to be pretty well built...is fairly comfortable and roomy and works well for what I needed it for. I use them a lot in hunting blinds so have to sit for long periods so wish the front was a little more comfie on my legs but it seems all chairs have that issue I have found so far. Over all though a well built and sturdy chair for larger people.I am 6'3 and 275 lbs in case that info may help someone.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Lodge

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than a month. Waste of hard earned money.
customer_reviews.text: Broke in less than a month, used twice. I'm 190 pounds, not huge by any means. Right before the return window. Moving forward I am going to buy these type of items are Walmart and I'm no longer using Coleman products including their coolers. I'd rather spend a few bucks more for quality such as Yeti.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hsieh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but there are two problems
customer_reviews.text: The chairs are very sturdy. I like everything about them except for two problems: (1.) The backend of the armrests are supposed to slide up and down the frame when you fold/unfold the chair. That design makes the backend of the armrest want to slide down when you are using it. There is nothing on the frame to lock the armrests in position. (2.) The headrest portion that sticks up just flops over if you try to use it as a headrest. I wonder why it was made that high. If you are shorter, like me, you can scoot forwards and lay back to use the back as a headrest but your back will not have any support.
customer_reviews.author: LAM777

customer_reviews.title: Not a well made chair.
customer_reviews.text: I can somewhat accept the fact that the char has fairly thin bars but what I can not accept is that the arm rests slide down so you can not put your arms on the rests making them useless. Now I have to figure a way to keep fix it since I am past my return window as this is the first time I have taken them out of the bag to use. Ugh....
customer_reviews.author: DJ Dale

customer_reviews.title: Five plus stars all the way!
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, I purchased 2 Coleman folding camp chairs and they lasted a long, long time until they eventually got sun rot from all their time on my sunny deck. I went without folding camp chairs for several years but missed having them for camping, extra seating on the deck, etc. These are by far some of the most durable folding chairs out there and they are extremely comfortable. I believe even a larger person would be happy with these. I highly recommend. Also, the cooler bag is kinda fun but I haven't really used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Almost perfect for people over 225 pounds. However, some people are looking for comfort in an outdoor, lawn or camping chair. Good luck with that. No outdoor seating is comfortable to me, with the exception of quality patio furniture. But THAT is not portable. (It beats standing!) Although this one is definitely not uncomfortable, it also beats the embarrassing bending, folding, breaking and falling out of a "standard" chair. I'm 280, it lets me sit when other big guys are standing, looking at the chairs that they have just broken. 5 stars, but a generous 3.5 stars for comfort. Update: It broke. Only the second use. Not the legs, but the armrest which supports the seat, thus rendering it useless
customer_reviews.author: Loyal customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply better than anything like it on the market.
customer_reviews.text: It is astonishingly comfortable, appears itself to weigh almost nothing, but is entirely sturdy. Folds into a carrying bag in which it is supplied, but open it is rock steady, and easily holds 235 pounds with significant comfort. Probably should have skipped the furniture stores altogether and just bought these. The 4-can cooler is also a deep pocket that holds an iPad and many other objects. Outstanding value, perfect chair.
customer_reviews.author: Trolley

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product so far. I am tall and large and this is the first folding chair that I didn't feel like it was going to collapse at any moment. Solid, comfortable, and even fits out two smallest children at the same time. Only negative thus far is that the cooler bag can be difficult to deal with when folding the chair up to go back in the bag. You have to find the perfect spot for it to be tucked away into or the chair won't fold up quite right. Gets compliments every time and several families ask about it and they all like the cooler bag in the arms.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyKing

customer_reviews.title: Nice foldable chair
customer_reviews.text: It's a foldable chair! Yeah, go chair. One minute its claustrophobic in its bag and next its spread out free as a bird with my fat butt sitting in it. Ohhh, I'm sorry chair 😏 It works and holds my big butt and I have always like the quality of Coleman. It's a brand I can usually rely on. I use this chair at my kids sports game and around the campfire. Easy to transport and use. You can't go wrong with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: RadiantBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I am a pretty big guy so I need something sturdy and comfortable, to which this fits the bill. I wanted a good comfy chair for the garage and or to keep in my truck. The chair does appear to be nice and sturdy and it is definitely very comfortable. Glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Big T.

customer_reviews.title: They’re just ok
customer_reviews.text: These chairs are just ok. They are not very comfortable and they are built for very large people. The carrying case is terrible, like other reviewers mentioned, which I didn’t think would be a big deal but it kind of is since I like to keep them neatly stored. I would recommend searching elsewhere for more comfortable chairs that are not oversized. The things I do like about them are the storage pockets and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price for such great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised at the negative reviews because my experience was quite the opposite with the awesome chair! It's has been sturdy and great quality supporting me (115lbs) sitting it in all sorts of funky positions and occasionally alsi carrying my weight with my dog Romeo who's a 70lb boxer. My favorite genius feature is the mini insulated ice box bag that zips up as a pocket on one of the arms of this chair! It's actually kept food cold all throughout the night with an ice block in it. I was very impressed! This chair however is not compact so I wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for something light weight to backbavk with.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: After chair replacement, still fell apart.  Save your money on the Coleman brand.
customer_reviews.text: Check fabric connections. I'm not abusive but the stitching on the corner of the right arm was not completed, causing it to come apart. Contacting Amazon on replacement or repairs... I'll get back to you. June 4th, 2020 replacement: refer to pictures. The chair has not been abused AT ALL, but where the fabric is secured by screws, one on the back had worked itself through and fabric came off and at one location the left arm side the fabric wore through exposing the metal arm. Honestly, the quality is not what you're expecting for a brand name product. I'd definitely recommend another brand that's built better.
customer_reviews.author: Pmag63

customer_reviews.title: Good chair for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I gave to this chair 5 stars considering it is pretty comfortable. It is very easy to fold and it arrives completely assembled, you just need to open the chair and it is reasldy to go. I am 5'10" and 164 pounds and the chair seems to be sturdy enough. I am not sure about the durability because I have used it for less than a week.
customer_reviews.author: Francis

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Loved this chair, but like others had mentioned the 3rd time it was used it broke. The metal just snapped at seat/arm location. We've had for one year, but only used 3 times. My husband is a body builder and this was extremely comfortable for him to sit in due to his large legs. He weighs 200lbs. Really had hoped with the Coleman name it would've lasted longer. I've attached pictures showing the chair looks new, no wear except where it came apart from the arm.
customer_reviews.author: mshmsh

customer_reviews.title: arm broke off on second use = return window closes quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This was such a comfortable chair, it pains me to see it is broken - but there it sits, with an arm bent off and no reasonable way to fix it. Evidently, I made the mistake of using the armrest as a support to get up out of the chair -- at which point the leg supporting the armrest bent in two. I wish I had sat on this thing before the return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: Eli C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: While I paid a little more for this than I wanted to, it was totally worth it. Very large and sturdy, and lots of compartments to keep everything one would need being out and about. While unfolding is no problem, for me, it is a little difficult to fold back up and put in the bag it comes with. Cumbersome is the word I would use. Otherwise it's a great chair and I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is total garbage. I think we have probably owned 100 folding camp chairs over the years. We bought 4 of these, and were excited about the features. The first one broke the first time someone sat in it. Then the other 3 had their arms start breaking within a couple days. Even my daughter (who weighs less than 100 lbs) broke the arm of her chair. Total garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stanton

customer_reviews.title: Great chairs but hard to fold into storage bag
customer_reviews.text: I really, really love these Coleman camping chairs! I especially love the sale I got them on because I wouldn't have paid full price for these. They are comfortable and very sturdy. They are wonderful for kids' outdoor sports as I can put their water bottles inside the cooler area. I have a little area for my phone as well, too cool! The only negative I have found is it is not easy to fold these chairs up and store them back in the storage bag. I mean, it's possible but definitely not easy.
customer_reviews.author: Caitie

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I liked the color and it was lightweight. It lasted less than 4 uses. I still had a Coleman folding chair from many years ago. I thought I would get a newer one with a cupholder. Quality has gone out the window with new Coleman stuff. I wrote the company with my thoughts and they never contacted me. They don't care. I will never buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: RON P.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Arm cooler rocks!
customer_reviews.text: So apparently I didn’t read the description too well. We just wanted two more fold up chairs, these were reasonably priced and would be here soon with Prime. We just opened them to use for the first time tonight and I was excited to see the arm cooler! Haha. It’s awesome for storing a few extra drinks (we’re having a fire outside), plus there’s a side pouch, chair is padded, way more comfortable that other fold up chairs, and plenty big. It’s been years since we ordered new outdoor pop up chairs, very impressed with the upgrades!
customer_reviews.author: S., Panda

customer_reviews.title: Disposable Coleman quad chair
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 3-months. Metal fatigue where armrest meets leg at slide. Consider this a disposable chair
customer_reviews.author: rzklkng

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a small Class B RV and these fit in my limited storage just fine. These are very well made and so far ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when the price was low on Amazon. Didn't open them for a couple of months as I really didn't need them. I purchased a small Class B RV and these fit in my limited storage just fine. These are very well made and so far have been on a few trips with no quality problems. The pockets on the sides are perfect for the Kindle, phone and other items. There's even a small lined cooler pouch to keep a couple of beverages cold. A very good chair at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Verbosemime

customer_reviews.title: COLEMAN = YES!
customer_reviews.text: We are so happy we splurged a little and went with these Coleman portable camping chairs. We often sit in the driveway and have happy hours, so these were perfect! They are durable, high-quality and comfortable. Not to mention that they look stylish, too! What a difference from the ones you can get at your local grocery store for $9 that are flimsy! Best features: These have a small "pocket cooler" for beverages on the side arm! Also, they have drink holders! You can't get much better than that! We highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S Carr

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable sturdy chair. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great chair for car camping. A little on the larger side but if you go to a more compact chair you will be sacrifice comfort so it evens out in the end. We have backpacking chairs that are more compact and lighter but they are not as comfortable. If you are looking for a car camping chair this is a great value and quality is on par with chairs that are 2-3 times more expensive. The integrated cooler in the arm of the chair is great for keeping a couple cans of beer cold. Storage pockets are great for holding phone or other items.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight+easy to carry; deep seat
customer_reviews.text: Planned to use this when I can take my grandsons to the park since seating and shade are limited. This chair is lightweight, has a matching bag that makes it easy to carry, and the bright color (red) makes it easy to see. My young grandsons love the chair but as a short person, I can't sit comfortably in the deep seat and find it very difficult to keep the chair from folding when I try to stand up. I had an old Coleman chair I loved, so will keep looking for something like that. Keeping it because the kids like it.
customer_reviews.author: DR deLuis

customer_reviews.title: Easily Broken
customer_reviews.text: Gotta be honest, and my wife and I have had six of these over the years, I'm convinced there is a manufacturing defect in these chairs. Others have (correctly) pointed-out they're not meant to bear weight like a cane. I'm big (almost 250 pounds), and all of mine have broken at the right side joint, right below the armrest. However, my tiny wife (who weighs less than 120, and who is LEFT handed) had had two of hers break, too, in the exact same place -- the right side (even though she never applies pressure on the right).
customer_reviews.author: TomR

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different product.
customer_reviews.text: Broken within 10 minutes of using it. Flimsy construction. Good for humans up to 100 pounds, and it may not even hold them. Such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: E.B.

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after a month and a half
customer_reviews.text: This chairs appears well built but within 3 weeks of purchasing, the right arm rest ripped off the grommet and would no longer support my arm resting on it. Then today, a month and a half after purchasing, the left arm rest detached from the frame where your hand would rest. It’s falling apart and I think I’m out of the return date range, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Faithful Amazon Customer since 2002

customer_reviews.title: Comfort !
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our RV and they are really nice, comfortable, big seat so my little dog can sit with me. Love the cooler attached and has an attached pocket for phone, book whatever. I'm very pleased with my purchase. They are also nicely padded so very soft and fold up is pretty easy. The carry bag is of course tight, could be a little bigger but I'm able to get them back into the carry bag with just a little effort. Also the back of the chair where your neck would be has extra material so it gives, you can actually lean your head back and rest your neck comfortably if you are not too tall. Love the dark blue!
customer_reviews.author: Pam D.

customer_reviews.title: The Sturdy, Deluxe Folding Chair
customer_reviews.text: Bottom Line: There are many options when it comes to folding/camping chairs, but this one is the premium option. It is sturdy, roomy, and even has a cooler pouch. If you expect to do a fair amount of sitting, and want a folding chair that has some weight to it while being comfortable, this one may be for you. Use: I purchased this folding chair after having gotten rid of all of my regular furniture in preparation for a move. I used this chair on a daily basis for over a month. Although no folding chair could ever be as comfortable as a couch, I actually did not miss my couch.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and handy chair!
customer_reviews.text: Looooove this chair! It’s sturdy and easy to open and close and the seat is large and comfortable. Two of my kids (ages 5 & 4) can actually sit on the chair at the same time! The built in cooler is so handy. I use it all the time for their water bottles and cannot imagine not having one attached to my chair now! Such a great investment. I bought two and am crossing my fingers they go on sale so I can order three more for the rest of my family members!
customer_reviews.author: Megan C

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip to the beach and was not disappointed. They are obviously easy to set up right out of the convenient bag. Love the comfort, I'm a short girl and they were a tad high for my short legs but my son and the rest of the family said they were perfect. The cooler bag is amazing for those drinkers like me who like them cold, not sitting out in the sun for 20m. Would buy these again, their price and ease of use, comfort... all make these chairs a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kimipk99

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I am a big and tall person. This chair is comfortable and I don't worry at all that when I sit it's going to break under my weight. I picked a brand that has lasted and was known for quality and I'm glad I did. I love the cup holder and the little pouch cooler. I have sat in this chair waiting in line for 7+ hours at a time. I was comfortable the whole time. No pain or stiffness. It can be a little tricky to get back into the bag, but nothing that can't be handled. This chair is great and I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lenaea

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair I love mine!!
customer_reviews.text: I just love this Coleman chair it is so sturdy and has a nice wide seat to sit in. It has a small cooler on one arm. It would fit 2 can drinks with ice. Description says 4 but it would be a tight squeeze. It also has a storage bag on the other side. It’s big enough for your cellphone, keys or a pack of cigarettes. I would definitely recommend it. I just love mine and I have already bought my daddy one because he loved it so much. Great Purchase!! Might end up ordering a couple more. These are really nice chairs.
customer_reviews.author: cody miller

customer_reviews.title: Can’t Beat Coleman Quality
customer_reviews.text: This Coleman chair is wonderful! Comfy, sturdy and light weight. It comes with a carry bag for easy portability. There’s a cute little cooler pocket in one arm if the chair. It easily accommodates a lunch box freezer pack to keep small items cool like a sandwich. The opening doesn’t accommodate a can tho. Convenient side pocket keeping a myriad of other essentials handy. Overall, this us a great chair, far superior to others that cost more.
customer_reviews.author: Mushroom Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair for larger people
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice robust chair that is still easy to tote around. It is very comfortable to sit in even for longer periods of time. If you are needing a chair for a heavy set person this is a great choice for the price and comfort. It has a cup holder on one side. We haven't used the small cooler/insulated part of the chair on the other arm rest besides to shove cellphones in from over heating in the sun. I really like this chair and glad i purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: C.C.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: It is not comfortable if you have normal sized legs. The seat is angled up, cinches the hamstrings above the knee and cuts circulation. I can’t sit in this chair for more than 5 mins without my legs falling asleep (due to circulation being restricted). The front support pieces for the arm rests reduce the available seating space as well, further constricting the body. This chair might sturdy and durable, but in terms of ergonomics it’s poorly designed.
customer_reviews.author: sid

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Chair, Carry Bag Sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Great chair, strong and durable for a bigger person (285 lbs.) but the carry bag is falling apart after only a couple months of light use. Specifically, the bottom of the bag is falling out which will soon make it completely unusable. The chair is a bit heavy but robust. Edit: Right after I reviewed this, the bag fell apart. I contacted Coleman who took weeks to respond, then told me in a strangely worded email with a non functioning support website link, to contact Amazon. . .
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Pack

customer_reviews.title: It's so comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a plus size (Very large) lady, so comfort is the utmost importance for me! This chair makes it easy to keep my drinks cool, since I spend most of my work shift talking to people this is a semi-high priority for me as well. Lastly there is a wonderful spot to store my wallet, phone, and Ipad until they are needed. The only con I can even begin to think of, is it sits too low to the ground for some people my size (my mom wouldn't be able to get out of the chair). Otherwise it's perfection in an on-the-go chair.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Not great for heavier people
customer_reviews.text: These chairs say they can support 300+ lbs--my bf is low 200's. He was using it one day and the arm support frame snapped as he was supporting himself to stand up. I think they're very nice myself, but we had only had these chairs a month or so before this happened. For Coleman to claim to be able to withstand that amount of weight and to have it snap under him in such a short amount of time is incredibly disappointing--not to mention embarrassing for my bf. Again, they're quite comfy for me, and all of the pockets and drink holders are convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Those little cushions make a big difference!
customer_reviews.text: I had some Ozark Trail chairs in the past, and decided to try to upgrade to these Coleman chairs for the padding and cooler. While the padding looks thin in the pictures (and it is) it actually makes the chairs far more comfortable. The cooler is also very practical, especially in 'these uncertain times.' These are a little bulkier and heavier than the Ozark trail chairs, but fit into the included bag, which also has a pretty sturdy shoulder strap. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: MikeNYC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to pack
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable camp chair. It's not too heavy to carry to the park or campsite, and it's easy to assemble and put away. I love all the pockets, including the side one that fits my tablet or book. The cupholder could be a little wider--my reusable water bottle doesn't fit. But overall it's a great value for the price, and so much better than the very cheap one I had before and couldn't sit in for more than five minutes.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable and a weird chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy and easy to assemble and setup. Material is soft and strong. The only downside is an odd chemical smell that is noticeable in an enclosed space like your car or garage (smells a bit like old vomit) . I'm assuming it is an outgassing of the chemicals it was made with and will fade over time - if not I will wash them down and rinse while crossing my fingers... Not noticeable when you are outside sitting in them.
customer_reviews.author: Ted in CT

customer_reviews.title: Love the Coleman Chairs
customer_reviews.text: We have always bought Coleman camping chairs. They are always such good quality and comfortable. I bought one of these and one of the big and tall chairs. This one I would say is a good relaxing chair. There is less support in the back than the big and tall, but it is super comfy. The cooler and media pocket are wonderful to have. It is definitely lighter to carry than the big and tall version. I love them both, they each have their benefits.
customer_reviews.author: MSK16

customer_reviews.title: Fisherman's special! Hubby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the hubby for the beach and for ballgames because our old Coleman chairs had been ravaged by mice in the garage. It's not comfortable at all for me because it pushes against the back of my legs and aggravates my sciatica, but he loves it! The insulated pouch on one side is perfect for food or bait. The pouch on the other side is big enough for a Kindle and phone, plus there are 2 drink holders. The bag it comes in is a little too snug to fit the chair back in without a wrestling match. Aside from that, it's a great fishing and camping chair!
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: Great folding chair - roomy and light!
customer_reviews.text: Used this chair for watching kids' games/activities on sideline. Lightweight to carry to/fr. car. Very large seat area -- it fits 2 small kids comfortably. Folding into the cover probably IS easy but since I've never done it before, it was a little bit tricky for me. Although I don't use the cooler option, it's a good spot to stick extra snacks or phone or car keys. I borrowed a folding chair from a neighbor that was $5 and while that did the job, I prefer spending more and getting a larger, more sturdy chair like this one. It was infinitely more comfortable than the cheaper folding chair.
customer_reviews.author: EMC9393

customer_reviews.title: Best chair in its class
customer_reviews.text: We spend a lot of time enjoying the outdoors and have gone through many chairs over the years. These larger chairs are by far the most comfortable we've ever owned. I'm 5'10 & 175lbs and there's plenty of room to stretch out in these. Although they take up a little more room folded up than their standard counter-part, the extra seating space they provide more than makes up for it. They're sturdy, fold up easy, and the little armrest cooler is a handy touch. For what you get, you cannot beat the price. We ordered four to completely replace our old standard size chairs and would absolutely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: mixedblood74

customer_reviews.title: Chair broke after 2 uses!
customer_reviews.text: We used the chair 2 times and it broke. Bought for my husband as a Christmas gift and he finally used it at our daughters softball tournament and it totally broke. He is about 210lbs which should be fine. Totally disappointed with Coleman! Wish I could return it .......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my other one just like it finally ripped at the back seam after 5 years. This is one comfortable chair. We fish ALL the time--4-5 times a week and my chairs take a lot of beatings with use. And these hold up so well. I leave this link in my wish list and go re-buy it everytime the other one gives up. They are a bit pricey, but worth every penny. Especially for bigger folks. The width and strength cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Thats Ron to You

customer_reviews.title: OVERSIZED & Smelly?
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about receiving this chair after trying to look for a comfortable one for a long time, and was really disappointed. I saw the thousands of reviews but did not bother to read them. When I got the chairs I found that they were oversized. I’m 55 165 and I was swimming in this chair. I had to put a pillow for back support. Definitely would not be able to sit in this chair for more than 30 minutes as someone that currently suffers from back pain. I decided to return it. Also the smell really bothered me (like chemicals). I did not even see there was a California prop 65 warning on these chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: and the fabric is nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The pictures don't do them justice. Purchased two, and will be purchasing more! They seem well built, and the fabric is nice and sturdy. I can see us using them for quite some time!
customer_reviews.author: DarkSlide

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Ideal for dry locations
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these particularly when social distancing outside at friends and family houses. We thought it would be safer to bring our own chairs. I really appreciate how sturdy these chairs are. I have also taken advantage of the various storage areas. These chairs are ideal for dryer locations. We have used them a few times at the beach and noticed that even though we set the chairs out to dry, the salt water rusted some of the bottom pieces of the chair. We will see how the hold up in storage for next year.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D

customer_reviews.title: Not a perfect design, but good quality
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these chairs to replace our old, dilapidated camping/tailgating chairs. These Coleman chairs are really cool, particularly because of the pocket on the side and the built-in cooler in the arm! We don’t the cooler feauture very much. My biggest complaint about these chairs is the head support—there is literally none. If you lean back, your head pushes the fabric and it just keeps going. The picture makes it look tall, but there is no support behind the back top section to keep it from folding.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 13 Months
customer_reviews.text: As I was getting ready to throw the broken chair in the dumpster, I was excited to see the One Year Warranty tag still on the bag. I bought two of these chairs new last year in advance of camping season, so I thought for sure I would be able to use the warranty and let Coleman know. Just came in to check the order date from Amazon and of course it was 13 months ago instead of 12 (just my luck). They are comfortable and attractive for the money, I was just shocked to see the metal break after basically 1 season of light use and always being kept out of the elements.
customer_reviews.author: A Lew

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable to sit in
customer_reviews.text: I am in self isolation working from home, desk chair damaged. We are moving soon and shipping way too long on desk chairs,so decided to get a camping chair,since we need a few anyway. I am pleasantly surprised how comfortable this chair is. I will be buying more in the future. It doesn't move easily once your are in it so not ideal as a desk substitute but I am using it with my lap top and table and I just pull the card table over the chair. I can sit far too long without realizing I need to take a break.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Merry

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these chairs to replace two I purchased last year. The chairs I replaced had aluminum supports and ended up collapsing after only 3 uses at the beach. The Coleman chairs are made of steel and are very sturdy. The seat is quite wide to accommodate plus sized persons. They are comfortable to sit in. The cup holder, 4 can insulated pouch built into the armrests, and side mounted accessories pockets are nice touches. I am confident that they will perform well for years to come. I had no problem getting the chairs back into the carry sleeves. You just need to take the time to carefully fold them up after use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stoneman

customer_reviews.title: Did you take your vitamins?
customer_reviews.text: This is a mixed review. However, let's be clear on comfort. Not. Miserable if you are under 5'6". Don't buy it you are short. Your feet won't touch the ground, circulation beyond your knees will be nil and the bad language will start. Is the chair sturdy? Moderately. Heavy? Moderately. Carry bag? Yes, but as is all too typical, undersized so bring the silicon spray or vaseline. Cupholder? Yes, however on the small size and fragile. In sum, be somewhat tall, very gentle and strong with a can of WD40 or else be unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coleman: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: Just bought in July. Used less than a handful of times. Arm just broke. This is an oversized chair. The regular sized chair bought from Walmart lasted years... I guess Coleman ain't what it used to be. I would request a replacement, but it's been past the 30 days return policy.
customer_reviews.author: KittyLove

customer_reviews.title: Five star as long as it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: Best of all the umbrella chairs I've tried. It's larger than most and the storage pockets are nice. There is one common problem with all of these chairs, they don't last. If you subject them to a few years of sun and rain the fabric rips out. They are fine if you keep them indoors but why bother to have one if it fails in the environment in which you choose to use it. (In my case, I live in a tropical setting where it is mostly sunny and bright with lots of rain, at times.)
customer_reviews.author: JBS

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Being this is a Coleman, I am disappointed in the quality. The little bit of time we have used the chair, it is ripping near some of the rivets in the back. It is a comfortable chair, the little cooler pouch is a handy feature and the shade of blue is nice. I would not buy this chair again just because I don't think the quality is worth the price. Not worth it to us.
customer_reviews.author: CameoRose

customer_reviews.title: Great! (except for stuffing it in the travel bag)
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have one and it's become a must-have item for meeting up with friends during social distancing. It's sturdy and I really like the extra pockets. I also usually travel with a Nalgene bottle of water which doesn't fit into most cup holders. The insulated pouch for cans of soda or beer also works great for giant water bottles! :) The only downside is trying to stuff everything into the little travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jen M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camp/Other Chair
customer_reviews.text: Not a lightweight but the benefit is a sturdy, comfortable, attractive chair for camp or whenever you need an extra chair. Easy to set up, a little tight in the bag (fold "in" the side accessories pockets first before collapsing chair). Good fabric, nice insulating and regular pockets--functional. Bag should hold up if you are gentle with it. Glad Coleman can still deliver. (Great price).
customer_reviews.author: ManfredWD

customer_reviews.title: Comfort of home on the go
customer_reviews.text: Do you you like to be able to relax wherever you can pop up a chair? Have you ever wanted to keep your drinks cold while you enjoy the sun? Well, this is the product for you! This chair is excellent for the great outdoors or your backyard. I would recommend this chair to anyone that needs a sturdy chair to accompany them on their outdoor excursions. I have taken this chair to the mountains, ocean piers, and dog parks and I have nothing bad to say. It is comfortable, durable and can hold weight up to 300lbs which is me + my dogs all for an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: RatingMan

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am a large guy. 6' and 250 lbs. Although I read good reviews about this chair and have had great past experiences with Coleman products I was very skeptical. Thankfully Coleman came through yet again. This is a very comfortable chair and easy to get in and out of. I like the features and it is very light to carry in the bag. I have only used it a couple of times so far but nothing in the construction suggests that it should not last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comfy and well made
customer_reviews.text: These were sturdy and pretty comfortable. I've got a wide butt and thighs so it was still a little uncomfortable to sit in long term, but definitely more comfortable than your standard narrow chairs. The hardest part was folding them back up, since the cooler pack kind of gets in the way. Not impossible though! So far these have been worth the money. They feel like they'll last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. S

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: About 10 years ago, I bought a set of four cheap folding lawn chairs for $10 a piece. I was hesitant to spend $26 dollars on one chair, but the difference is notable. This chair is much wider and more padded. The cooler and side pocket components also make this an excellent purchase. This chair seems quite sturdy; if it proves otherwise I will update my review, but so far I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The arm rests slide down and don’t support your arms at all.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed in these chairs. They’re pretty and sturdy but the arm rests slide down with the slightest bit of leaning on them. I’m going to have to wrap tape or rubber bands on them to keep them from sliding down. The cheaper chairs we bought from the amazon brand have straps that hold the arm rests in place. I expected as much from these “nicer” chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Great Scott

customer_reviews.title: It is what it says it is.
customer_reviews.text: I love these chairs. I would recommend this to anyone. I love the cooler pouch and trust me when I say where I live it gets hot hot hot. I use it for camping, and love the feature. I love the weight rating being so high. I love the extra holder on the side also. Very useful for camping. I can't complain really. This chair is what it says it is. I would buy this if you are looking for a good quality chair for camping etc.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great camping chair!
customer_reviews.text: Took this with me on a 4 day camping trip which included taking this to the beach and the campsite. It held up well to both environments. We had sunny, hot weather and it was absolutely soaked in a rain storm and it held up well for both situations. I didn't really care about having a cooler on the arm, but I used it at the beach and it worked as well as one would expect a bag cooler on a chair to work. Makes a handy pouch for other things as well. I weigh about 270 lbs and it held up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mitllewop

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These chairs were just perfect for our needs. Easily stored in trunk of car so as to be kept readily available for outdoor meet-ups with friends, allowing us to safely be seated at a proper social distance from one another. Never expected them to be so comfortable which is an added plus. Our friends recommended them and I’m so pleased we took their advice. No hesitation in recommending these chairs.
customer_reviews.author: gaye

customer_reviews.title: Budget Chair with Nice Options
customer_reviews.text: The chair arrived with a broken screw so one leg was not attached to the support. My husband drilled a new hole and attached the foot support to the leg. It works fine now. For the price, it has some good features. The seat is a little "saggy" for my taste but appreciate the higher back. We sell crafts at farmer's markets so this is light weight seating with great features like an armside cooler and side sling for magazines, books, kindle, phone, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Sanders

customer_reviews.title: gave these chairs away after one use
customer_reviews.text: I've had Coleman chairs in the past, and generally like them. I wasn't sure about the cooler feature on these, but ordered anyway. While I'm a fan of the mesh bag to hold miscellaneous junk the built in coolers were another thing altogether. I was so unimpressed that I donated to a friend with a cabin - who won't need to stuff these into their travel bags . I'd purchased for carrying to events, but he cooler made it REALLY challenging to repack the chairs after use.
customer_reviews.author: Ann V.

customer_reviews.title: Best Lawn Chair Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these chairs. Im a bigger girl. And they are so comfortable to sit in with room to move around.. Love the little side cooler. We put snacks in or it holds 4 beer cans. . Everyone that sits in them .Always say they are going to order one. I also only have one arm. And I can carry 2 at a time. So they aren't very very to lug around..
customer_reviews.author: Mandee Waterman

customer_reviews.title: I returned it
customer_reviews.text: I found it cheaply made and uncomfortable. The arms wouldn't even support my arms. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: JML

customer_reviews.title: This chair is just what i was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This chair came really well packed, good job Amazon. The chair comes in a nice carrying sleeve, but the chair itself is nice and wide and comfortable. I tried camping chairs from the big box mart stores and they felt like they were going to fall apart after a few uses. I don't like the big Coleman logo on the backrest. The chair is well built, looks good and the price is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I fits so I sits
customer_reviews.text: My hips are wide...like wide wide. I was really nervous about getting a chair online, especially such a great priced one. I fit!!! If you’re afraid you’re too wide, you’re probably not. Only complaint is that you can feel the bar under your thighs, and it’s very deep, so my feet don’t touch the ground when I sit in it. But overall I’m pretty happy!
customer_reviews.author: Anny Won

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely satisfied!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend because I left his chair with a friend and let me tell you he was so excited when he seen the size of the chair and the accessories that came with it. It’s awesome that there is a cooler on the side of the chair where you can stick your beer and drinks to keep cold on a hot sunny day. I am so excited to see his reaction when he sits down in it this weekend for a fire! Not to mention Coleman is one of the best camping gear’s !
customer_reviews.author: Nnylirek

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid chair. Super comfortable. Great quality. A little heavy but that's because of the sturdiness. Only gripe is that the bag Coleman provides is barely enough to fit the chair. Coleman has a history of this. Buddy of mine has a canopy of theirs and the bag just barely fits all of its parts. A couple of inches of bag material is all that's needed to make this perfect.
customer_reviews.author: G,A,&K

customer_reviews.title: Good chair!
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I thought I was purchasing. I love it. It's sturdy and comfortable. My toddler loves to sit in it too. I will say I came back to buy another one and found the price had doubled! I bought this chair for $24. I picked this one because of the decent reviews and the lower price than other equivalent chairs. I don't think I would pay $50 for this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: game changer!
customer_reviews.text: we bought these for our vacation in destin, fla. the built in cooler was a total game changer. i kept juice pouches and mini water bottles in mine, and my husband did some cans of soda. Both stayed nice and cold despite the outside temp, which was around the 00s and high 90s. They're very sturdy and held up well to being thrown around, climbed on, and dragged around by kids and adults alike. These are going to be our go-to chairs from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Jebelle87

customer_reviews.title: Chair Frame Snapped After 15 months
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big girl, 250 pounds. But not 300, which is what this chair is rated for capacity, which is why I bought it. It is roomy and the cooler is neat and the storage pocket and cup holder are ideal. The chair is roomy and comfy and it's stored in my car's trunk to use at games, bon fires, etc., as needed. But last night the frame under the arm snapped right off, leaving me embarrassed and chairless while at a fire with friends. I'm very disappointed that the chair, which is expensive for a folding camp chair, broke already and I'm going to have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S. Michniewicz

customer_reviews.title: good chairs so far
customer_reviews.text: I've only carried to a couple of ball games,,, the "cooler" pocket isn't big enough for 4 cans; that was disappointing as it was part of the reason I selected this chair. makes a better place for keys and my phone than cans of pop. next time I will buy the rocker chairs, they appear to be more comfortable. of course they are difficult to put back in the carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice camping chairs
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty nice camping chairs! They're a bit bigger and beefier than many other models, so if you're a bigger/heavier person that's a plus. Even if you're not it means they'll probably last longer. The cup holder is likewise a bit bigger than on some chairs, and the little storage areas are also a nice addition. The one spot is ostensibly a "cooler" area, which is could be used for that, but you can also toss whatever in there and keep it out of the elements. Definitely worth the few bucks more you pay for these versus the cheapest of the cheap $10 chairs or whatever you see around sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Classic Music Fan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Seats
customer_reviews.text: We would not buy these again because they are so cheaply made. So far the rivet has come off of the bottom foot attachment, the arms pieces slide down the chair, and they take some effort to fold. We more than likely will return the two we bought because they really are bottom of the line. Not too comfortable and we are always having to move the arm pieces back up to rest our arms, but they sag down just as quickly as you put them up. Very dissatisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: Work-of-heart

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Definitely see what people mean about the arms sliding down. Just with the weight of my elbow they start sliding with no way to secure them short of glue. But my main gripe with the chair is comfort. The only way to sit comfortably is to cross my legs. If I sit un-crossed, the front legs that lead up to the arms dig into my thighs uncomfortably. I'll be pawning this off to a friend and buying a new chair. Guess that's what I get for cheaping out.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Strong heavy duty chair but not for lightweights!
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty chair. However I returned it as it was difficult to place in carrier case and heavier and bulkier than I expected.i an an older woman and it was too much chair to handle. If you are looking for a good solid heavy duty camping chair, this is a great option that I would recommend if you are physically fit and able to carry it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine, but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for under $15-20, but I think it's overpriced at anything more than that. I never use the "cooler"... it ends up being a trash receptacle with my kids' old yogurt that I find a week or more later -_- Don't get me wrong, it's a comfortable chair and I'm glad I have it, but I don't sit in camping chairs long enough for it to matter much. Would probably rather have 3 of the basic $7 quad chairs from some sporting goods store sale.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Beware people with tall backs and broad shoulders
customer_reviews.text: This chair appears well made, but just doesn't fit me. i'm a big guy (6'3", 230lbs), and it's more than wide enough, but the poles supporting the very top corners of the back come in right behind my shoulders and make it an extremely poor fit for me. I bought this as being good for big/tall, but it just doesn't fit my body lengthwise. It does appear very well constructed though, so we'll keep it as a guest chair in the camper, but it isn't a fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: boskone

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy as my kids say
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my kids to use on their first Cub Scout camp out and they loved them! Don’t really have anything to compare them to but if my 7 and 8 year old can load them in and out of a car by themselves, set them up on their own, say they are comfortable and get excited about the cup holders, accessories, etc then they must be pretty awesome because if given a chance to complain about something my kids don’t hold back.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: A must for the car ~
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep in my car for portable, comfortable seating. I was skeptical of any folding chair being both lightweight and comfortable—but this chair fits the bill! It’s super comfy, has great design, features places to hold drinks and a book, and is easy to fold and put away. (Also, I’m about 200 lbs, and this chair feels sturdy and safe.) A great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: T. Oliver

product_meta.title: Coleman Portable Camping Quad Chair with 4-Can Cooler
product_meta.description: Have a cold drink at hand at the campsite, BBQ or picnic with a Coleman Cooler Quad Chair. The cooler built into the armrest holds up to 4 cans and provides easy access to a cold drink once the one in your mesh cup holder is empty. While you sip on your favorite beverage, the fully cushioned seat and back only adds to your relaxation. If you want your hands free, the side pockets work nicely to store your book, magazine or some snacks. When the fun is done, the chair easily folds up into a carry bag for easy transport and storage. Roomy 24 inches seat.
feature_bullets: Built-in Cooler: Keeps up to 4 cans cold and easily accessible
Hours of comfort: Thanks to fully cushioned seat and back
Convenient features: Side pockets, mesh cup holder, adjustable arm heights
Built to last: Strong steel frame supports up to 325 pounds
Built in arm rest cooler holds up to four cans
Mesh cup holder keeps a fifth drink at hand
Storage pocket to keep magazines and personal items
Durable construction, heavy duty steel frame supports up to 300 lbs.
Compact, folds up to fit inside most car trunks
Carry bag for easy transport and storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
